# Government Tender Announcement

## Title
Training Facility and Role Players

## Reference Number
PW-KIN-519-8718
Amendment Number: 2

## Solicitation Number
W6399-23DB22/B

## Publication Date
2022-12-02

## Tender Closing Date
2022-12-16T14:00:00

## Amendment Date
2022-12-15

## Overview
Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites qualified companies to submit a proposal for the provision of training facilities, equipment, and personnel to support a combination of key categories for the Department of National Defence (DND). The key categories include:

*   **Land Exercise Effects**: Land-based training exercises
*   **Specialized facilities, platforms, and equipment**: Equipment and platforms for specialized training
*   **Aviation Exercise Effects**: Aviation-based training exercises
*   **Subject matter experts**: Experts in various fields, including role players and human intelligence

## Trade Agreements
This tender is subject to the following trade agreements:

*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)

## Regions of Opportunity
This tender is applicable to the following regions:

*   British Columbia
*   Foreign (excluding the province of British Columbia)

## Contracting Entity and Contact Information
The contracting entity for this tender is:

*   Public Works and Government Services Canada
*   Address: 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
*   Contact Person: Herb Choquette
*   Email: herb.choquette@pwgsc-tpsgc.gc.ca
*   Telephone: (613) 449-8446
*   Facsimile: (613) 545-8067

## How to Submit
Bidders are required to submit their proposals through the CPP Connect service to the above-mentioned contact email address at least six days before the tender
